monogr.title: A chorologicall discourse of the vvell ordering, disposing, and gouerning of an honorable estate or reuennue : Briefely describing the duties of diuers officers therein to be imployed: for the better preseruing, improuing and augmenting of the same. Together with certaine briefe and necessary tables for the valuation of leases, annuities, and purchases, either in present or in reuersion. Written by T. C. Gent
monogr.author: Clay, Thomas

div.head: CARMEN AD Auctorem, seu Passus ad Athenas.

lg.l: TAm bene, tam graphica describis singula penna,
Ʋt facile constet cuiuis tentare volenti
Commoda de studijs multa scatere tuis.
Ingenij specimen das non vulgare sagacis,
Et lumen genij non mediocre boni.
• sta legat Quaestor, studeat Geometricus ista:
